newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani IRRI-6 rice prices rise on Oman buying.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani IRRI-6 rice prices rise on Oman buying.

text.p: Pakistani rice IRRI-6 variety export prices rose slightly on demand from Oman but Basmati variety fell because of dwindling sales abroad, dealers said on Thursday.
Prices were mixed in the past week.
Oman has tendered for 6,000 tonnes of IRRI-6 rice for shipment in September, a dealer said. The tender will open on September 7.
IRRI-6 prices rose to $290 per tonne FOB in the past week from $280 a week earlier, the dealer said.
One official of the state-run Rice Export Corporation of Pakistan said Basmati prices fell because of low demand from abroad. Demand will rise on arrival of the new crop in October.
A three-member Japanese team, led by Kazumi-Koga, has shown interest in buying at least 500 tonnes of super Basmati variety rice in October or November, dealers said.
The team plans to introduce super Basmati at American food restaurants in Japan, they said. Japan imported 112 tonnes of Basmati rice in the past year.
Prices of IRRI-6 rice were likely to fall as the new crop would reach the market in September, a month earlier than Basmati crop, Khalid Ghori of Matco Rice Processing said.
Exports in 1995/96 (July-June) fell 26.21 percent to 1.366 million tonnes worth $450 million, from 1.852 million worth $454 million in 1994/95.
Following are exporters FOB rates per tonne:
August 22 August 15
Basmati $515 $540
Prices in the domestic markets in rupees per 100 kg:
August 22 August 15
-- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
